text: Suppose someone, S, is physically ‘wired’ in the following way. When any two sentences with the following syntactic properties are tokened in the subject’s belief box: P1:P—>Q P2: P a third sentence of the following form is automatically tokened in S's belief box: ((e] Given this, we can predict what will happen next if the following sentence-tokens occur in S's belief box: P1: If the sun is out this morning, I'll walk to class. P2: The sun is out this morning. In conformity with the logical schema outlined above, Pl and P2 will cause a tokening in S'’s belief box of a sentence expressing the consequent in P1, namely: C: I'll walk to class.
